TopicTitle: Vehicle picking up speed on the runway without an engine [Runway Isnt Level With Kerbins Curvature]

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.5 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: windows 10 | CPU: Ryzen 5900x 12 core 24 thread 4.2 Ghz | GPU: radeon 6600xt | RAM: 32gb ddr4

 

I landed my airplane on the runway and lost the engine because it touched the ground. The vehicle proceeded to tilting back and then to settle on the landing gear and coming to a stop without breaking input.

After it stopped it proceeded to pick up backwards speed

 

Included Attachments:

NewWorkspace.json

Edited December 25, 2023 by The Space Peacock

Yeah this is intended behaviour because the runway is completely flat. Also happened in ksp1.

The runway is so long and perfectly flat, kerbin is so small that at the ends of the runway, you are actually going uphill.
